title.rendered: Define what Bootstrap is.

content.rendered: Bootstrap is a front-end framework that is commonly used to create HTML, CSS, and JS web applications. Its layout is very responsive, fast, and easy to use. It mostly focuses on building mobile applications using design templates. You can also create interactive components like drop-downs, forms, buttons, button groups, alerts, cards, tabs, and many more components.

excerpt.rendered: Bootstrap is a front-end framework that is commonly used to create HTML, CSS, and JS web applications. Its layout is very responsive, fast, and easy to use. It mostly focuses on building mobile applications using design templates. You can also create interactive components like drop-downs, forms, buttons, button groups, alerts, cards, tabs, and many more […]

title.rendered: Why Bootstrap is used for mobile application developments?

content.rendered: It is used for mobile application developments because it has several responsive features and design templates that are easy to use. In other terms, it uses a Mobile-first approach.

excerpt.rendered: It is used for mobile application developments because it has several responsive features and design templates that are easy to use. In other terms, it uses a Mobile-first approach.

title.rendered: What are the main features of Bootstrap 4.

content.rendered:
Its features include:

  • Free and open-source.
  • Compatible with almost all modern browsers like Google Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Opera, and Internet Explorer.
  • Responsive features.
  • Easy to use.
  • Lightweight.
  • Consists of several components and utilities.
  • Support for jQuery plugins.
  • Easily customizable.
  • Mobile-friendliness.
  • Simple integration.
  • Good documentation support.
  • Availability of a large number of templates, themes, and plugins.

excerpt.rendered: Its features include: Free and open-source. Compatible with almost all modern browsers like Google Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Opera, and Internet Explorer. Responsive features. Easy to use. Lightweight. Consists of several components and utilities. Support for jQuery plugins. Easily customizable. Mobile-friendliness. Simple integration. Good documentation support. Availability of a large number of templates, themes, and plugins.

title.rendered: Name key components of Bootstrap 4.

content.rendered:
Its key components include:

  • Scaffolding: Bootstrap built on a responsive grid system consists of a 12-column grid.
  • JS Plugins: Contains JS and jQuery plugins.
  • CSS: Contains CSS files.

excerpt.rendered: Its key components include: Scaffolding: Bootstrap built on a responsive grid system consists of a 12-column grid. JS Plugins: Contains JS and jQuery plugins. CSS: Contains CSS files.

title.rendered: What do you understand by the term container?

content.rendered: Containers are the most fundamental components in Bootstrap. It behaves like a container where you can put HTML code, and it is a part within the page where the content of the site can be placed to make it responsive and fast.

excerpt.rendered: Containers are the most fundamental components in Bootstrap. It behaves like a container where you can put HTML code, and it is a part within the page where the content of the site can be placed to make it responsive and fast.

title.rendered: What do you mean by Bootstrap ClassLoader?

content.rendered: Bootstrap ClassLoader is a part of Java and a main parental class of class loader.

excerpt.rendered: Bootstrap ClassLoader is a part of Java and a main parental class of class loader.

title.rendered: How many types of layouts are there in Bootstrap 4?

content.rendered:
There are two types of layouts in Bootstrap 4.

They are:

  • Fluid layout
  • Fixed layout

excerpt.rendered: There are two types of layouts in Bootstrap 4. They are: Fluid layout Fixed layout

title.rendered: What is the fluid layout?

content.rendered: The fluid layout is useful when you need to make an app that involves the full width of the screen. The fluid layout adjusts itself according to the browser size.

excerpt.rendered: The fluid layout is useful when you need to make an app that involves the full width of the screen. The fluid layout adjusts itself according to the browser size.

title.rendered: What is the fixed layout?

content.rendered: The fixed layout is the default layout type and it also responsive and easy to use. Unlike the fluid layout, it cannot adjust itself according to the browser size. The fixed layout should be 940px in most cases.

excerpt.rendered: The fixed layout is the default layout type and it also responsive and easy to use. Unlike the fluid layout, it cannot adjust itself according to the browser size. The fixed layout should be 940px in most cases.

title.rendered: How can you display code in Bootstrap?

content.rendered: The fixed layout is the default layout type and it also responsive and easy to use. Unlike the fluid layout, it cannot adjust itself according to the browser size. The fixed layout should be 940px in most cases.

excerpt.rendered: The fixed layout is the default layout type and it also responsive and easy to use. Unlike the fluid layout, it cannot adjust itself according to the browser size. The fixed layout should be 940px in most cases.

title.rendered: How can you display code in Bootstrap?

content.rendered:
You can display code in two ways.\

They are:

  • Using the <code> tag – This method is used to display code as inline code.
  • Using the <pre> tag – This method is used to display code as a standalone block.

excerpt.rendered: You can display code in two ways.\ They are: Using the <code> tag – This method is used to display code as inline code. Using the <pre> tag – This method is used to display code as a standalone block.

title.rendered: How can you make an image round in Bootstrap 4?

content.rendered: You can use the .rounded class to make an image round.

excerpt.rendered: You can use the .rounded class to make an image round.

title.rendered: What is a progress bar?

content.rendered: A progress bar is an indicator to show the progress of a particular process.

excerpt.rendered: A progress bar is an indicator to show the progress of a particular process.

title.rendered: Name the contextual classes that are used with the progress bar.

content.rendered:
The contextual classes used with the progress bar are as follows:

  • The .bg-primary class
  • The .bg-secondary class
  • The .bg-success class
  • The .bg-danger class
  • The .bg-warning class
  • The .bg-info class
  • The .bg-white class
  • The .bg-light class
  • The .bg-dark class

excerpt.rendered: The contextual classes used with the progress bar are as follows: The .bg-primary class The .bg-secondary class The .bg-success class The .bg-danger class The .bg-warning class The .bg-info class The .bg-white class The .bg-light class The .bg-dark class

title.rendered: What are responsive utility classes in Bootstrap?

content.rendered:
Responsive utility classes in Bootstrap are a set of classes that are used to conceal or exhibit the HTML elements based on screen resolution that discerns by media query in Bootstrap.

Example: “hidden-md-down”

excerpt.rendered: Responsive utility classes in Bootstrap are a set of classes that are used to conceal or exhibit the HTML elements based on screen resolution that discerns by media query in Bootstrap. Example: “hidden-md-down”

title.rendered: What are the different button styles in Bootstrap 4?

content.rendered:
In Bootstrap 4, there are lots of styles that we can use with the buttons.

Some of them are:

  • Buttons with colors
  • Buttons with a colored outline
  • Small buttons
  • Large buttons
  • Block-level buttons
  • Button links

excerpt.rendered: In Bootstrap 4, there are lots of styles that we can use with the buttons. Some of them are: Buttons with colors Buttons with a colored outline Small buttons Large buttons Block-level buttons Button links

title.rendered: What are Bootstrap alerts?

content.rendered:
Bootstrap alerts are used to create presume alert messages, which add styles to make the messages more noticeable to the user

The following contextual classes can be used to create colourful alerts:

  • The .alert-primary class
  • The .alert-secondary class
  • The .alert-success class
  • The .alert-danger class
  • The .alert-warning class
  • The .alert-info class
  • The .alert-light class
  • The .alert-dark class

excerpt.rendered: Bootstrap alerts are used to create presume alert messages, which add styles to make the messages more noticeable to the user The following contextual classes can be used to create colourful alerts: The .alert-primary class The .alert-secondary class The .alert-success class The .alert-danger class The .alert-warning class The .alert-info class The .alert-light class The .alert-dark […]

title.rendered: Define Bootstrap 4 thumbnails.

content.rendered: It is a way to use the layout images, videos, text, etc. in a grid system. We can create thumbnails by adding a tag with the .img-thumbnail class around the image.

excerpt.rendered: It is a way to use the layout images, videos, text, etc. in a grid system. We can create thumbnails by adding a tag with the .img-thumbnail class around the image.

title.rendered: Explain the modal in Bootstrap4.

content.rendered: A model is an inherited window that is layered over its parent window. This is used to augment the user experience and add different functionalities. Model windows are created with the help of the modal plugin.

excerpt.rendered: A model is an inherited window that is layered over its parent window. This is used to augment the user experience and add different functionalities. Model windows are created with the help of the modal plugin.

title.rendered: Which are the classes used for pagination in Bootstrap4?

content.rendered:
The classes used for pagination are the .pagination class, the .page-item class, the .page-link class, the .pagination-sm class, the .pagination-lg class, the .active class and the .disabled class.

The following table provides more information about the above classes:

The following table provides more information about the above classes:   Class Function 1 The .pagination class, the .page-item class and the .page-link class These three classes are used to create basic pagination. 2 The .pagination-sm class It creates small pagination while decreasing the font size and spacing […]

title.rendered: Explain what Bootstrap’s collapsing elements is.

content.rendered:
It allows you to collapse any particular element without using any JavaScript code.

To use this feature in Bootstrap, you have to add data-toggle=” collapse” to the controller element along with a data target to automatically assign the control of a collapsible element. We can use this by writing .collapse(options) etc.

excerpt.rendered: It allows you to collapse any particular element without using any JavaScript code. To use this feature in Bootstrap, you have to add data-toggle=” collapse” to the controller element along with a data target to automatically assign the control of a collapsible element. We can use this by writing .collapse(options) etc.

title.rendered: What is well in Bootstrap 3?

content.rendered: Bootstrap well is a form of container which thrives or makes the content look recessed on the web page. It also wraps the content using the .well class.

excerpt.rendered: Bootstrap well is a form of container which thrives or makes the content look recessed on the web page. It also wraps the content using the .well class.

title.rendered: Explain the uses of the carousel plugin in Bootstrap.

content.rendered:
The carousel plugin in Bootstrap is used to make sliders on the web pages or your site. Several carousel plugins are used in Bootstrap to display large contents within a small space by adding sliders.

Example: .carousel(options), .carousel(‘pause’), .carousel(cycle’), .carousel(‘prev’), .carousel(‘next’).

excerpt.rendered: The carousel plugin in Bootstrap is used to make sliders on the web pages or your site. Several carousel plugins are used in Bootstrap to display large contents within a small space by adding sliders. Example: .carousel(options), .carousel(‘pause’), .carousel(cycle’), .carousel(‘prev’), .carousel(‘next’).

title.rendered: What will be the output of the below code and why?

content.rendered:
<div class="progress">
          <div class="progress-bar bg-success" style="width: 65%">
                <span class="sr-only">75% successfully completed</span>
          </div>
          <div class="progress-bar bg-warning" style="width: 20%">
                <span class="sr-only">30% completed with warnings</span>
           </div>
           <div class="progress-bar bg-danger" style="width: 15%">
                 <span class="sr-only">15% did not complete</span>
            </div>
</div>

If we place multiple bars with the same .progress parent element, Bootstrap will pile them into one single progress bar. As we know, in Bootstrap the sum of the progress bar is 100%. So, the progress bar will give the result full width and fully populated.

excerpt.rendered: If we place multiple bars with the same .progress parent element, Bootstrap will pile them into one single progress bar. As we know, in Bootstrap the sum of the progress bar is 100%. So, the progress bar will give the result full width and fully populated.

title.rendered: How can we customize links to pagination?

content.rendered: We can customize the links by using the .disabled class for unclickable links and the .active class for indicating the current page.

excerpt.rendered: We can customize the links by using the .disabled class for unclickable links and the .active class for indicating the current page.

title.rendered: Explain input groups in Bootstrap4.

content.rendered:
Input group is put out from controls.

Input group is put out from controls.

We can prepend and append addons elements to a .form-control in front of or behind text inputs by using the .input-group-prepend class and the .input-group-append class respectively. Further, you can use the .input-group-sm class to make a small input group and the .input-group-lg class to make a large input group.

excerpt.rendered: Input group is put out from controls. Input group is put out from controls. We can prepend and append addons elements to a .form-control in front of or behind text inputs by using the .input-group-prepend class and the .input-group-append class respectively. Further, you can use the .input-group-sm class to make a small input group and the .input-group-lg class to make a large input […]

title.rendered: How can you create a tabbed navigation menu?

content.rendered: We can create a tabbed navigation menu by making a basic unordered list with the .nav base class and the .nav-tabs class.

excerpt.rendered: We can create a tabbed navigation menu by making a basic unordered list with the .nav base class and the .nav-tabs class.

title.rendered: How can you create a pills navigation menu?

content.rendered: A pills navigation menu can be created by making an unordered list with the base class of .nav the .nav-pills class.

excerpt.rendered: A pills navigation menu can be created by making an unordered list with the base class of .nav the .nav-pills class.
